item.title: [667] Someone ele's pvp kill you cant pick up?
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:12, topic:465454”][quote author=13lack drag link=topic=570677.msg4134593#msg4134593 date=1351550006]

i think its clickingbuttons.java

This is a 667, as you can see in the title. 667’s do not have clickingbutton.java
[/quote]

Perhaps not, but they do have a class that deals with interface interactions. However, I believe that isn’t the problem.[/quote]

That was what I was thinking, though I’m pretty sure it has to do with something having to do with the addGroundItem, ad I listed above.

item.title: [667] Someone ele's pvp kill you cant pick up?
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:8, topic:465454”][quote author=13lack drag link=topic=570677.msg4134291#msg4134291 date=1351519551]

I don’t work with revisions higher than 474, so this is a shot in the dark. You might want to check out how the Loot is assigned to the player who got the kill. This also might be done on purpose to stop looters.

The senddeath for pking is fine, i dont see anything wrong with it. as for to stop looters, i could see how that may be, but i don’t think its anything to do with that.
[/quote]

Then I suggest you start checking your Item on Ground mechanics.

EDIT: Also could be caused by the items sitting out for so long.[/quote]

Item On Ground is basically what I posted ^^^. The sitting out for so long doesn’t have anything to do with it, because it will dissapear after a set time. If you drop an item in the wildy, anybody can pick it up. Its just the killing.

Read full topic

item.title: [667] Someone ele's pvp kill you cant pick up?
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

So basically, we were fooling around and pvping in my server.

One guy kills another, leaves loot, and teles.

The loot appeared, seems normal, but no one can pick it up.

Here is a picture I got

How would I fix this? Please and Thank you.

Here are my AddGroundItem and UpdateGroundItem codes:

[code=java]
public static final void addGroundItem(final Item item,
final WorldTile tile, final Player owner,
final boolean underGrave, final long hiddenTime/* default 3minutes */,
boolean invisible) {
if (owner != null && owner.getBoneDelay() != -1
&& owner.getBoneDelay() > Utils.currentTimeMillis())
return;
final FloorItem floorItem = new FloorItem(item, tile, owner,
owner != null ? underGrave : false, invisible);
final Region region = getRegion(tile.getRegionId());
region.forceGetFloorItems().add(floorItem);
if (invisible && hiddenTime != -1L) {
if (owner != null)
owner.getPackets().sendGroundItem(floorItem);
WorldTasksManager.schedule(new WorldTask() {

   public void run() {
    if (!region.forceGetFloorItems().contains(floorItem))
     return;
    int regionId;
    regionId = tile.getRegionId();
    /*
     * if (owner != null && underGrave ||
     * ItemConstants.isTradeable(floorItem)) {
     * //region.forceGetFloorItems().remove(floorItem); if
     * (owner.getMapRegionsIds().contains(
     * Integer.valueOf(regionId)) || owner.getPlane() !=
     * tile.getPlane())
     * //owner.getPackets().sendRemoveGroundItem(floorItem); }
     */
    try {
     if (ItemConstants.isTradeable(item) || !ItemConstants.isTradeable(item)) {
      floorItem.setInvisible(false);
      for (Player player : World.getPlayers()) {
       if (player != null
         && player != owner
         && player.hasStarted()
         && !player.hasFinished()
         && player.getPlane() == tile.getPlane()
         && player.getMapRegionsIds().contains(
           Integer.valueOf(regionId)))
        player.getPackets().sendGroundItem(floorItem);
      }
     }
     World.removeGroundItem(floorItem, hiddenTime);
    } catch (Exception e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
    } catch (Error e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
    }
    stop();
   }
   /*
    * { region = region1; floorItem = flooritem; tile = worldtile;
    * owner = player; underGrave = flag; super(); }
    */
  }, (int) hiddenTime);
 return;
 }

}

public static final void updateGroundItem(Item item, final WorldTile tile,
        final Player owner) {
    final FloorItem floorItem = World.getRegion(tile.getRegionId())
            .getGroundItem(item.getId(), tile, owner);
    if (floorItem == null) {
        addGroundItem(item, tile, owner, false, 360, true);
        return;
    }
    floorItem.setAmount(floorItem.getAmount() + item.getAmount());
    owner.getPackets().sendRemoveGroundItem(floorItem);
    owner.getPackets().sendGroundItem(floorItem);

}[/code]

EDIT: Once they appear, the killer may pick it up, though the items do dissapear from ground, for players who did not kill.

Read full topic
